question: The "Boxer Rebellion" happened in which nation?
explanation: The "Boxer Rebellion" happened in China between 1899 and 1901. This rebellion is also known as the Yihetuan Movement. This rebellion was an anti-imperialist, anti-foreign and anti-Christian rebellion. The Qing dynasty of China declared war against the attack of "Eight-Nation Alliances" on China. Boxers, with the support of the Qing Empire, waged war against foreign powers. Finally, Eight-Nation Alliances defeated Boxers.
